title: Twin preterm neonates with cardiac toxicity related to lopinavir/ritonavir therapy.
abst: We report twin neonates who were born prematurely at 32 weeks of gestation to a mother with human immunodeficiency virus infection. One of the twins developed complete heart block and dilated cardiomyopathy related to lopinavir/ritonavir therapy, a boosted protease-inhibitor agent, while the other twin developed mild bradycardia. We recommend caution in the use of lopinavir/ritonavir in the immediate neonatal period.
title_plus_abst: Twin preterm neonates with cardiac toxicity related to lopinavir/ritonavir therapy. We report twin neonates who were born prematurely at 32 weeks of gestation to a mother with human immunodeficiency virus infection. One of the twins developed complete heart block and dilated cardiomyopathy related to lopinavir/ritonavir therapy, a boosted protease-inhibitor agent, while the other twin developed mild bradycardia. We recommend caution in the use of lopinavir/ritonavir in the immediate neonatal period.
split_sentence: Twin preterm neonates with cardiac toxicity related to lopinavir/ritonavir therapy.
We report twin neonates who were born prematurely at 32 weeks of gestation to a mother with human immunodeficiency virus infection.
One of the twins developed complete heart block and dilated cardiomyopathy related to lopinavir/ritonavir therapy, a boosted protease-inhibitor agent, while the other twin developed mild bradycardia.
We recommend caution in the use of lopinavir/ritonavir in the immediate neonatal period.
